column4: Ubuntu is generally quite fine with drastically altering hardware
so if i dd my OS partition and move to new hardware i dont need to do a repair install?
no... but dd is kind of a sucky way to do it... requires the new disk to be >= size of old one, and you have to resize after to make use of the new space... and wastes time copying free sectors
last year I replaced my whole motherboard, cpu, ram, booted up just fine... added a new ssd and migraded the system over to the new drive in the background while still using it
